availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Lewis C. Coulter (Mays Lick, Kentucky, saddler)

body.p: Mays Lick, Kentucky, saddler. Pennsylvania native. Married to Anna B. McMillen Coulter on November 15, 1852. Father of Mary A. Coulter, Nannie Coulter, and Anna Coulter. Saddler in Mays Lick in 1860. Employed Coulter as a saddler in Mays Lick in 1860. Owner of a manufacturing company in Mays Lick in 1862. Saddler in Mason County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mason, Mays Lick, p. 58.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records – Microfilm (1852-1914), KDLA, Film 994027-994058: Mason County Marriages, 1852, p. 2 of 40 of microfilm (accessed via Ancestry.com).
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records – Microfilm (1852-1914), KDLA, Film 994058: Mason County Deaths, 1857, p. 487 of 688 of microfilm (accessed via Ancestry.com).
Internal Revenue Assessment Lists for Kentucky, 1862-1866 NARA RG 58, Microfilm Series M768, Roll 15, Mason County, Kentucky, 1862, p. 23 of 754 of microfilm (accessed via Ancestry.com).
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records (Provost Marshal General's Bureau; Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865), NARA RG 110, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865 (Civil War Union Draft Records), Mason County, KY, September 1863, p. 66, p. 69 of 212 of microfilm (accessed via Ancestry.com).
